battle

Class Battlefield

  • java.lang.Object
    • battle.Battlefield

  • public class Battlefield
extends java.lang.Object
    Directs the course of the battle

      void attack(Division d1, Division d2, int location)
      attack Division 1 and Division 2 attack each other Here are certain rules that apply First the damage output of each division is calculated( number of units in division * the strength of 1 unit *0.2(if the other division has a weakness against this one)) Then we drop the HP(Health) of each division by that damage.
      void battle()
      battle the battle between each facing tiles takes place
      int endGame()
      if one of the player has no soldiers left at the end of a turn, the other player wins and the game is over

                            int type,

      • attack

        public void attack(Division d1,
                   Division d2,
                   int location)
        attack Division 1 and Division 2 attack each other Here are certain rules that apply First the damage output of each division is calculated( number of units in division * the strength of 1 unit *0.2(if the other division has a weakness against this one)) Then we drop the HP(Health) of each division by that damage. Here there is a special rule: If there is only one division in the two facing tiles, that division attacks the division facing the tiles in the base, without getting any damage)

      • battle

        public void battle()
        battle the battle between each facing tiles takes place

      • returnFromBattle

        public void returnFromBattle()
        returnFromBattle The soldiers that survived the battle return to the base

      • endGame

        public int endGame()
        if one of the player has no soldiers left at the end of a turn, the other player wins and the game is over

        public java.lang.String toString()
